title: Sync/CRM/QuotationHeaders
description:
Any change in the header of the Quotations will lead to a new timestamp value in the header. The API will return header data in the API call.
The sync api's have the goal to keep the data between Exact Online and a 3rd party application the same.
The sync api's are all based on row versioning and because of that it is guaranteed to be unique. Every time an existing record is changed or a new record is inserted, the row versioning value is higher than the highest available value at that time. When retrieving records via these api's also a timestamp value is returned. The highest timestamp value of the records returned should be stored on client side. Next time records are retrieved, the timestamp value stored on client side should be provided as parameter. The api will then return only the new and changed records. Using this method is more reliable than using modified date, since it can happen that multiple records have the same modified date and therefore same record can be returned more than once. This will not happen when using timestamp.
The sync api's are also developed to give best performance when retrieving records. Because of performance and the intended purpose of the api's, only the timestamp field is allowed as parameter.
The single and bulk api’s are designed for a different purpose. They provide ability to retrieve specific record or a set of records which meet certain conditions.
In case the division is moved to another database in Exact Online the timestamp values will be reset. Therefore, after a division is moved all data needs to be synchronized again in order to get the new timestamp values. To see if a division was moved, the /api/v1/{division}/system/Divisions can be used. The property DivisionMoveDate indicated at which date a division was moved and this date can be used to determine if it is needed to synchronize all data again.
The API has two important key fields, the Timestamp and the ID. The ID should be used to uniquely identify the record and will never change
. The Timestamp is used to get new or changed records in an efficient way and will change for every change made to the record.
The timestamp value returned has no relation with actual date or time. As such it cannot be converted to a date\time value. The timestamp is a rowversion value.
When you use the sync or delete api for the first time for a particular division, filter on timestamp greater than 1.

AmountDC.description: Amount in the default currency of the company

AmountDiscount.description: Discount amount in the currency of the transaction

AmountDiscountExclVat.description: Discount amount excluding VAT in the currency of the transaction

AmountFC.description: Amount in the currency of the transaction

CloseDate.description: Date on which the customer accepted or rejected the quotation version

ClosingDate.description: Date on which you expect to close/win the deal

Created.description: Date and time on which the quotation was created

DeliveryAccount.description: The account where the items should delivered

DeliveryAccountCode.description: The code of the delivery account

DeliveryAccountContact.description: The contact person of the delivery account

DeliveryAccountContactFullName.description: Full name of the delivery account contact person

DeliveryAccountName.description: The name of the delivery account

DeliveryAddress.description: The id of the delivery address

Description.description: By default this contains the item description

Discount.description: Discount given on the default price. This is stored as a fraction. ie 5.5% is stored as .055

DueDate.description: Date after which the quotation is no longer valid

IncotermVersion.description: Version of Incoterm  Supported version for Incoterms : 2010, 2020

InvoiceAccount.description: The account to which the invoice is sent

InvoiceAccountCode.description: The code of the invoice account

InvoiceAccountContact.description: The contact person of the invoice account

InvoiceAccountContactFullName.description: Full name of the invoice account contact person

InvoiceAccountName.description: The name of the invoice account

Modified.description: Date and time on which the quotation was last modified

OrderAccount.description: The account that requested the quotation

OrderAccountCode.description: The code of the order account

OrderAccountContact.description: The contact person of the order account

OrderAccountContactFullName.description: Full name of the order account contact person

OrderAccountName.description: The name of the order account

Project.description: The project linked to the quotation

QuotationDate.description: Date on which the quotation version is entered or printed. Both during entering and printing this date can be adjusted

QuotationID.description: Identifies the quotation. All the lines of a quotation have the same QuotationID

QuotationNumber.description: Unique number to indentify the quotation. By default this number is based on the setting for first available number

Remarks.description: Extra text that can be added to the quotation

SalesPerson.description: The user that is responsible for the quotation version

SalesPersonFullName.description: Full name of the sales person

Status.description: The status of the quotation version. 5 = Rejected, 6 = Reviewed and closed, 10 = Recovery, 20 = Draft, 25 = Open, 35 = Processing... , 40 = Printed, 50 = Accepted

VersionNumber.description: Number indicating the different reviews which are made for the quotation

YourRef.description: The number by which this quotation is identified by the order account
